item.title: Surprise! Another billionaire comes out a... well, guess what
item.description: "Sir" James Arthur Ratcliffe, one of five richest men in the UK, estimated at around 30 billion GBP, currently resident in Monaco due to tax avoidance reasons, joins (again) with Brexiteer Nigel Farage of Reform UK (England's very own opportunist populist MAGA party solely addressing racism, envy and hate) by stating "the UK is has been colonized by immigrants, it's costing too much money". Ratcliffe's corporates (mostly petrochemical (Ineos), Manchester United) have been accepting state subsidies in the millions for decades now. By the way, imgur wouldn't allow "billionaire" and "racist" as descriptive text, so... yeah.
item.dc:creator: neuronicle

item.title: Half a world and half a century apart.
item.description:
I saw this ( https://imgur.com/gallery/maga-love-riots-insurrection-when-fighting-dictatorship-Psgpljf ) post and it sent me on a trip down memory lane. I've been saying for a while that the USA, like Northern Ireland, is an occupied state but while Northern Ireland was occupied by a foreign nation, the USA is occupied by itself and it's been really strange seeing photographs coming out of Minnesota that are so similar to the images I grew up seeing.
Derry. 1971. Street fighting against British soldiers. Bruno Barbey. A bit before my time but a common enough scene through the decades.
Protesters clash with federal agents in Saint Paul, Minnesota, on Thursday © Octavio Jones/AFP/Getty Images (Found in an article titled "JD Vance defends ICE killing of woman in Minneapolis") Fucking balls of steel to throw hands or sticks against an armed occupier.
Derry. Irish Youth and British soldiers come face to face. 1971. Gilles Peress The smug prick smile is real familiar.
AFP via Getty Image
Paramedics treat victims of the shooting Four men and a teenage boy were shot dead on the Ormeau Road in south Belfast in February 1992. Gunmen from the loyalist Ulster Freedom Fighters burst into Sean Graham’s bookmakers and opened fire. BBC Needless to say, there were civilians who took it upon themselves to "enforce the law" on behalf of the military.
Derry. 30th January 1972. As the shooting starts on Bloody Sunday, people fall to the ground. Gilles Peress
1972: Bernadette Devlin, Independent Unity MP for Mid-Ulster and founder member of the People's Democracy movement, gives her side of the story to the press at the House of Commons after she punched Home Secretary Reginald Maudling for lying about Bloody Sunday. Frank Barratt / Getty Images Bernadette is a badass for the ages. The sort of person who would face down an armed failure with a smile and a smartassed comment.
Derry. Riots following the deaths of two Catholic teenagers who were accidentally killed by British Army troops who drove into a group of rioters hurling petrol bombs. The rioters throw rocks and petrol bombs and the police respond with plastic bullets. 1981. A young rioter prepares to throw a petrol bomb at some British soldiers. Peter Marlow
Derry. Ten years after the arrival of British troops in the province. The barricades are once more dividing Catholics and Protestants in areas of Belfast and Londonderry. Children eating their ice creams while soldiers patrol the streets of Londonderry. 1979. Peter Marlow
A protesting man is shot point-blank in the face with what appears to be a marker round or a rubber bullet at the scene where ICE agents fatally shot a woman earlier in the day in Minneapolis on Jan. 7, 2026. Christopher Juhn/Anadolu via Getty Images
Fr (Later Bishop) Edward Daly, pictured waving a white handkerchief in the defining photograph of Northern Ireland’s 1972 “Bloody Sunday” killings You're not at Bloody Sunday yet but it feels like that's just a matter of time.
Photograph by Charly Triballeau / AFP / Getty
Belfast. The Queen’s Jubilee riots. 1977. Peter Marlow
1973. The incongruities of daily life in the urban war zone. For years, the people of Northern Ireland lived in a strange and strained symbiosis with the occupying British army. Philip Jones Griffiths Trespass didn't mean much back then either.
Milltown Cemetery, West Belfast. 1988. Mourners at a Republican funeral flee for cover as they are attacked by a Michael Stone, an Ulster loyalist and UDA volunteer. Chris Steele-Perkins
And the bootlickers spewing hate while bravely standing behind armed paramilitaries is nothing new.
1969: British soldiers stop a man trying to carry his baby through a barbed-wire barricade on the Catholic Falls Road area of Belfast. James Jackson / Getty Images
U.S. Border Patrol agents detain a person near Roosevelt High School during dismissal time as federal immigration enforcement actions sparked protests in Minneapolis, Minnesota, on January 7, 2026. Kerem YUCEL / AFP via Getty Images
1970: A commandeered bus is driven backwards through a line of women calling for an end to the violence during riots in Falls Road. Malcolm Stroud / Getty Images
A border patrol tactical unit agent sprays pepper spray at a protester attempting to block an immigration officer’s vehicle from leaving the scene where a woman was shot and killed by a federal agent earlier in Minneapolis on Wednesday, Jan. 7, 2026. Alex Kormann/The Minnesota Star Tribune via Getty Images
1972: Young people confront British soldiers minutes before paratroopers opened fire, killing 14 civilians on what became known as Bloody Sunday. The standoff is near barricade 14 on William Street in Derry/Londonderry, Northern Ireland. William L. Rukeyser / Getty Images
1972: The remains of the 13 people who died on Bloody Sunday. A 14th victim died months later from his injuries. Independent News And Media / Getty Images
1985: A Falls Road mural warns informers against betraying the nationalist community (Touting means informing the authorities). Kaveh Kazemi / Getty Images
Youths with petrol bombs during Rioting on the Falls Road, West Belfast, Northern Ireland, The Troubles, 1976 © Alain Le Garsmeur
Images from Minnsota are a bit harder to properly source and attribute unfortunately.
A soldier warns Crispin about unexploded bomb blasts and live gunfire during rioting, the 10th of September, 2005. Photo: Crispin Rodwell.
A crowd gathers behind a barbed wire barricade placed by the British Army in the wake of the Battle of the Bogside, Derry, Northern Ireland, in late summer 1969. Photograph by Independent News and Media, Getty Images
Catholic nationalists—who desired Northern Ireland's independence from Britain—demonstrate atop British Army barricades in Belfast on September 10, 1969. Photograph via Associated Press
Border Patrol agents stand guard as protesters block a street after a driver of a vehicle was shot in Minneapolis on Jan. 7. (Tim Evans/Reuters)
Like I said, no Bloody Sunday yet but they've got the "Cold blooded murder without consequences" bit down.

item.title: I lost my boy, but he’s finally home.
item.description:
It was suggested that I try to post about this again. The last 3 months have been some of the most devastating of my life. Losing my boy Peter Paul, has taken a huge toll on me. My vet is amazing and they were able to help me get him cremated... with his paw prints and tail print ?? My health declines and Peter Paul's brother, Deeble, is still battling an abscess. I have an out of pocket cost I have to pay by the 15th in order to continue my occupational therapy and regain normal function in my right arm. As an artist this is... important, to say the least. Deeble has a veterinary appt on Friday the 13th and it's going to be a hard one guys, l'm not gonna lie. I might have a really hard decision to make. I feel alone and scared but this community had been so beautifully welcoming, supportive and empathy towards my dealings with chronic illness, disability and pet struggles. I'm sharing my ko fi link for if anyone likes art, rats, or feels like helping out if they can spare it https://ko-fi.com/darkratlord My direct Paypl is @sillygooseinc I'm at a loss and cannot afford pride at this time. Thank you so much for reading and to anyone who has kept up with us. My brain feels like it is short circuiting with pain but there has to be another side, right? Have a good day imgurians
This rainbow bridge poem killed me.
My deebs <3
He gives kisssses
Drew this in the mental hospital
He takes his medicine so good
☹️☹️☹️?
I miss you so much
item.dc:creator: DarkRatLord3000

item.title: Return of the Meme: 1613 (luftballoons)
item.description:
Let's get this bread. EDIT: this will be my last post. I can't keep track of what memes amuse me that have pro facist/anti-immigration overtones that im unaware of anymore, and so it's best not to share anything lest I be offending common humanity. It's been a great ride, folks.
The Xiongnu may have been the origin of the Huns [citation needed]
Hell yeah
Ailianthus is a really obnoxious invasive tree.
Pretty long for a White-throated Sparrow. [This meme is about bird banding]
Pippin tax! Today's message from Pippin: "but that's impossible" [I swear that's what it sounded like he said] ______ 1) Are you on the run to a safe place and passing through Arizona on your way to safer grounds? My apartment is open to you to crash at, and it is a safe space. Pippin and I will make you a meal and gladly share tea, wine, or mead with you. 2) Hey! Take your meds with a full glass of water, please. Do it for Pippin, or Space Mom, or better yet, do it for yourself. 3) Ĝefeloað wē. We will carry on. 4) all funds from the sales of items at these two links will be sent to support charities aiding to fight for Trans rights in the US (not just T-shirts!) https://www.teepublic.com/t-shirt/74812801-all-conures-are-anarchists https://www.teepublic.com/t-shirt/74811778-whiptail-pride 5) Since multiple people have requested this over the last two weeks or so, my ko-fi is: https://ko-fi.com/codyandpippin

item.title: GovBrief Today #377
item.description: Nothing is more dystopian than gathering pregnant migrant children in a detention center where adequate reproductive health care isn't available for high risk pregnancies. Horrible things happened today. The Speaker of the House called for six Democrats to be criminally charged for their video encouraging military service members to refuse illegal orders. Despite court orders against it, the IRS shared migrant tax data with DHS. And somehow CBP now has laser weaponry to disable drones and fired it in Texas without alerting anyone. None of the other stories matter. Get on the phone, get into your email and messages, and tell every single politician who relies on your vote to stop the government from sending pregnant children to a detention center because they are unaccompanied. Every state and county has child protective services. Use them instead of jail cells in a state where abortion is banned. We've emailed 6,000+ stories over 377 straight nights. The algorithm doesn't always show them to you. Subscribe now at govbrief.today #GovBriefToday #Resist Subscribe (It's Free!) - https://gbounacos.substack.com [1] https://go.govbrief.today/arctic-sentry [2] https://go.govbrief.today/israel-wh-iran [3] https://go.govbrief.today/states-sue-health-cuts [4] https://go.govbrief.today/pregnant-children-texas [5] https://go.govbrief.today/save-act-passed [6] https://go.govbrief.today/cbo-forecast [7] https://go.govbrief.today/pentagon-coal [8] https://go.govbrief.today/el-paso-laser [9] https://go.govbrief.today/second-carrier-iran [10] https://go.govbrief.today/bondi-search-data [11] https://go.govbrief.today/usattorney-fired-5hours [12] https://go.govbrief.today/prison-transfer-stop [13] https://go.govbrief.today/cbp-clearview [14] https://go.govbrief.today/ice-footage-lost [15] https://go.govbrief.today/grandma-jailed-checks [16] https://go.govbrief.today/irs-dhs-shared [17] https://go.govbrief.today/nj-ice-website [18] https://go.govbrief.today/florida-west-bank [19] https://go.govbrief.today/trump-stitt-rino [20] https://go.govbrief.today/bondi-epstein [21] https://go.govbrief.today/johnson-indict-dems [22] https://go.govbrief.today/religious-committee [23] https://go.govbrief.today/target-ice-protest [24] https://go.govbrief.today/house-canada-tariffs Subscribe (It's Free!) - https://gbounacos.substack.com

item.title: Even fascists don't care about dead fascists
item.description:
Fascism is strength. Leaders are only strong while alive. Death is the ultimate failure. Oh, *you* may be expected to die nobly for The Cause, but never the Great Men.
You could argue she took it down because it upset her, but then there's the whole "twerking onstage in leather pants a week after he transitioned to dead".
